subject: JUnit with JDK 1.1.8?
msgSnippet: According to http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm, I should be able to run the MoneyTest tests by entering java MoneyTest on the command
messageBody:
According to http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm, I
should be able to run the MoneyTest tests by entering "java MoneyTest"
on the command line.

First I added junit.jar to the command line:

C:\junit3.7\junit\samples\money>set
classpath=c:\junit3.7\junit.jar;%CLASSPATH%

Then I ran the test. Dir output below as a sanity check.

C:\junit3.7\junit\samples\money>dir
Volume in drive C is WINTERMUTE
Volume Serial Number is D8D6-46F9

Directory of C:\junit3.7\junit\samples\money

06/18/2001 03:25p <DIR> .
06/18/2001 03:25p <DIR> ..
05/21/2001 10:18a 665 IMoney.class
05/21/2001 10:18a 854 IMoney.java
05/21/2001 10:18a 2,548 Money.class
05/21/2001 10:18a 1,664 Money.java
05/21/2001 10:18a 4,691 MoneyBag.class
05/21/2001 10:18a 3,860 MoneyBag.java
05/21/2001 10:18a 5,665 MoneyTest.class
05/21/2001 10:18a 5,342 MoneyTest.java
8 File(s) 25,289 bytes
2 Dir(s) 15,903,163,904 bytes free

C:\junit3.7\junit\samples\money>java MoneyTest
Error loading class MoneyTest: Wrong name

C:\junit3.7\junit\samples\money>


Why am I getting this error? Does JUnit not work with JDK 1.1.8? I
couldn't find any system requirements on the JUnit site. I'm using the
JDK that ships with WebObjects 4.5. I'm running on Windows 2000.

Your help is appreciated. thx,

Jim
